Markup: Syntax Highlighting

Michael Rose - August 8, 2014

From Michaelâ€™s Rose Minimal Mistakes. Syntax highlighting is a feature that displays source code, in different colors and fonts according to the category of terms. This feature facilitates writing in a structured language such as a programming language or a markup language as both structures and syntax errors are visually distinct. Highlighting does not affect the meaning of the text itself; it is intended only for human readers.
